Description:
Historic Former Moorookyle School Site
If it's a piece of history you're after then look no further than this charming cottage on the former Moorookyle School site.
Enjoy the easy care garden, with established trees, embrace the panoramic views of Mt Moorookyle and Mt Kooroocheang and surrounding farming land on rich volcanic soil.
Property Features include:
* 2 bedroom cottage
* Floating timber flooring
* Kent wood heater
* Sunroom/porch
* Bore water
* Single garage & carport
* Sundry shedding/woodshed
Ideally located on approx. 1/2 acre just out of Smeaton, 25 minutes to Daylesford or Ballarat, and only 15 minutes to Clunes and Creswick
Insights: 3071 Creswick-Newstead Road, Smeaton VIC 3364 was last sold in 2017.

Description:
Rich Farming land on approx. 7.8 acres – Zoned Farming
This small parcel of farming land just under 8 acres will be ideal for a hobby farmer or extra land for an existing portfolio. With stunning 360 degree views including Mt Bolton. Mt Beckworth, Cattle Station Hill and Springmount this land also has a small dam for livestock and is cleared ready for use. Just north of Acsot-Creswick Rd and a little under 20 minutes to Ballarat CBD and 7 minutes to Creswick this parcel is well equipped to handle further infrastructure, livestock or crop.

Description:
Dream Locale To Build Your Dream Home
This attractive allotment is found at the prestigious Goldfield Resort Creswick. The parcel is 515m2 in size with a fabulous frontage of 21 meters that will easily hold your larger dwelling. Any abode constructed would grant amazing views over the course, with greens, bunkers, fairways and dams all within chipping distance. There are beautiful gum trees, walking & mountain bike tracks to enjoy, kangaroos and birdlife too. The block is the shortest of strolls to the 19th hole to take advantage of the bar and restaurant. The Resort is 2 minutes to the hub of town, 10 minutes to Ballarat and 25 minutes to Daylesford. With Melbourne just an hour away any home built could also be the perfect weekender. Investors should note the township has the lowest possible rental vacancy percentage. If you think your family deserves the loveliest of lifestyles, you should consider this allotment.
Insights: 5 Augusta Drive, Creswick VIC 3363 was last sold in 2017.

Address: CA 3/4 Wrigleys Road Creswick North VIC 3363
Description:
Superb 111 acres just minutes to Creswick
Offers around $335,000
An ideal way to set up your life dream.
Situated on the edge of the thriving township of Creswick and just 20 minutes to central Ballarat, this allotment offers enormous potential to live the rural lifestyle you have dreamed of, just minutes into town.
Perfectly positioned to build your ideal home (STCA) or alternatively presents a rarely seen opportunity for horse enthusiasts or other rural pursuits. This block in the Farming Zone hosts several potential home sites with spectacular panoramic views to the district's volcanic hills.
With 8 main paddocks with a historic mining site on title, this block has a seasonal creek meandering through several sections of the property.
10% Deposit
Settlement: 60/90 days

Description:
Presentation perfect with lake views!
Enjoying a private location, this immaculately presented home overlooks picturesque Lake Calambeen, offering a unique real estate purchasing opportunity. The home is only minutes from the amenities of the Creswick township, yet has the privacy views of a “house in the country”! The home comprises a spacious master bedroom complete with built in robes as well as three more spacious bedrooms including one with an ensuite. There are two well sized living areas plus a dining area, and the near new kitchen will not disappoint your family chef. Features of the home include decorative cornices, air conditioning, gas heating and a timber decking for outdoor living. Outside the block is fenced, has front and rear vehicle access with plenty of room for a caravan, and a 6m x 12m lock up shed - complete with power and a concrete floor. A unique property that is guaranteed to impress.
Phil Hayward : 0419 107 112

Description:
The Big Entertainer
This magnificent 4-bedroom home is set on 10 acres offering privacy and space just minutes to central Creswick and 20 minutes to Daylesford and Ballarat. The large undercover outdoor area offers the perfect entertaining space and is fully fenced, perfect for children or pets. The modern home is well presented, with large light and bright living spaces, beautiful sunsets, hardwood flooring, spacious master bedroom with WIR and ensuite, well-appointed kitchen with dishwasher and open plan dining/living.
-10 Acres (approx.) of flat land with olive grove
-13m x 10m concreted shed with power connected & an 8m x 5m carport
-2 x 27,240L Poly Tanks for rain water storage
-2kw back to grid solar system
-Wood heating, split system heating/cooling & fans
-Mains power, water treatment system, bottled gas
Inspections are highly recommended and are offered by private appointment only.

Address: 510 Talbot - Mt Cameron Road Red Lion VIC 3371
Description:
TALBOT DISTRICT FARMLAND WITH POWER AND DAM - 35 HA (88 ACRES)
Situated between Mt Cameron and Mt Glascow , this strong farming area enjoys A 520mm rainfall annually and is highly suited for mixed farming enterprises. There is one good sized dam, the farm is in one paddock made up of 3 titles . There are 3 road frontages and power runs through the property. The seasonal Splitters Creek runs through the middle and there are clumps of mature eucalypts along the creek and throughout the paddock. The block is just 10km to Talbot, 50km Castlemaine and Ballarat , 90km to Bendigo and 165km Melbourne. Access is by sealed road and the block has been fenced for running sheep. There are plenty of surrounding treed reserves for bush walking and riding in the great and quiet Aussie bush.
Insights: 510 Talbot - Mt Cameron Road, Red Lion VIC 3371 was last sold in 2017.

Description:
First home buyers, investors or tree-changers take note
Here is a unique opportunity to own- your own low maintenance two bedroom unit in central historic Creswick. Freshly painted inside and out, this light and airy property offers two generous bedrooms, a spacious open plan kitchen/ dining/lounge and a functional laundry/bathoom. Complimented with gas energy saver heater and a split cycle heating /cooling system, also NBN is connected. Located in a quiet street only minutes from the center of town and being part of a boutique block of five townhouses all with their own street frontage and front and rear yards. Expected rental is $185.00 per week. Inspect now.

Splendid Young Home With Many Comforts
This attractive young home is only a few years old and is just a minute's drive to the hub of town. With fabulous proportions throughout, each family member has their own space. The expected comforts of a young home such as central heating and cooling are provided. A stylish finish throughout will also please. A functional kitchen with ample bench-space, large pantry, breakfast bar, stainless steel appliances and a 900mm oven delights. Privacy and security are had at this quiet locale and security doors to the abode. This residence is close to schools, public transport and just 10 minutes to Ballarat or just over 20 minutes to Daylesford for your shopping and pampering. It's all done for you to just move in and enjoy.

Description:
Grand Smeaton Manse & Former School Building
Restoration has made this historic manse and adjacent school a showpiece for todays living. Positioned in Smeaton, just 15 minutes from the notable tourist destination of Daylesford and 25 minutes from all the action of Ballarats CBD, this 6.54 acre lifestyle will delight those with country living dreams or for those wishing to give their hidden talent a chance to shine.
Sympathetically restored with traces of yesteryear still in place, this magazine worthy property offers modern appointments and conveniences along with the beauty of its grand old gardens and surrounds in the mix. Three bedrooms, two formal lounge rooms and a separate dining room provide floorplan movement with a stunning kitchen and light filled sunroom adding further appeal to its design. Shaker style cabinetry, timber benches and floors along with a wood fire, create an outstanding work space in the kitchen while the sunroom is fully timber lined with three double French doors opening onto the attached pergola or alfresco zone. The home is serviced by a quality hydronic central heating system, NBN internet, and 80,000 litre water storage
Draped in vines and paved with old clinker bricks, this property is just steps away from the old school timber classroom, which provides a large 6.5 x 10.7m central room to set up a studio, gallery or provide a generous performance space, while a further kitchen and entry add facilities for perhaps a diverse bed & breakfast (STCA). External toilets are also available.
Rural views, a winter creek and old style shedding add to the propertys attraction, while a paddock could easily be put in place to house your pony. The neighbouring property which is the Presbyterian Church built and opened in 1860 and currently operating just 2 Sundays a month with a mass service. Completing this diverse package is the panoramic views to Mount Kooroocheang, the distant blanket of farmland, the double carport, secret gardens, rain water tanks, the established fruit trees and gardens along with the sundry sheds and workshop spaces available.
Smeaton is a welcoming community which would embrace any new resident to add their talent to the area or just enjoy a new family to the long history of the town. A stunning residence which provides future opportunities call our agent today for further details.
Expressions of Interest Close Friday 24th March at the office of PRDnationwide, Ballarat at 4PM

2 Bedroom Brick Unit In Popular Creswick
Located in a neat and tidy unit complex is this sound brick unit that is perfect for retirees, investors, couples or first home buyers alike. Comprising two good sized bedrooms, functional kitchen with gas appliances, spacious lounge room, ducted central heating and cooling throughout, outdoor pergola area, SLUG with remote garage door plus workshop with power and all situated on a low maintenance allotment. NBN is also available. The property is ready for you to move into or rent out straight away so contact Buxton Real Estate today to arrange your own inspection.

Description:
IDEAL SECLUDED WEEKENDER
Located in Amherst around 4kms from Talbot Town Centre is this stunning piece of land on 24 acres (approx.). The land is mostly cleared, has been used for a weekender and for grazing land. The property has previously had a planning permit for a dwelling that has now expired. Located just off the Avoca-Talbot Rd, there is a seasonal creek, lovely established trees, including fruit trees, and the property used to house a homestead where there are still some relics. You could try your luck at prospecting for gold! To find the property follow the Talbot-Avoca Rd out of Talbot for 4kms approx. and take the next left after Baker Street and opposite Lacey Street.
Contact Alisa Johnson at our Maryborough office on 0409 935 766 for a Section 32 and for more information.
Alisa Johnson : 0409 935 766

Description:
Lifestyle or equine property adjoining State Forest
Superbly positioned just outside Creswick, and with easy access to Ballarat, Daylesford and Melbourne via the Western Hwy, is this lifestyle or equine property. Offering 22 acres, the land is fenced with horse appropriate fencing and has 6 paddocks with laneways, with water to each from the large dam on the property. Including full size sand based dressage arena and timber round yard this property offers fantastic value for the facilities on offer and the bonus of being a quick trot to the State Forest. The home will also delight with it's sweeping 180 degree views and double Glazing and comprises 4 bedrooms (each with BIR's/WIR to master),Study (or 5th) 2 livings zones of spacious proportions, a well appointed kitchen/dining, main bathroom and ensuite to master bedroom. With views to delight, you will love this property for its space, privacy and sweeping vistas. A rare opportunity.
Phil Hayward : 0419 107 112

Description:
Ideal Investment Property Or First Home
Scaling down or starting out, this lovely weatherboard home offers; panoramic views of Springmount, the serenity of the country while also providing the convenience of living just moments from the buzz and action of beautiful Creswick.
Presented with a huge front yard and offering a single carport to the rear, this property could also provide an adequate investment opportunity with the home currently with a rental value of $230 per week.
With the opportunity to update, this home provides lovely period elements with a sun-filled wide double door entry, ceiling roses in each room and the original kitchen still working with full efficiency. The floorplan is ideal for a young family or empty nesters, while; a little planning, some handyman talent and some summer styling in the garden will provide a gorgeous country home for many years to come.
The kitchen is a generous open plan, with the surrounds of the original fire place housing the freestanding gas cooker, while cabinetry is along one wall with room to dine centrally. The fully carpeted living room offers the comfort of a gas heater along with a strategically placed split system and ceiling fan for that little extra breeze. Built in robes and a convenient ensuite feature in the master room, while the two further bedrooms offer built in robes. The bathroom has been updated over time while the laundry is an ideal size to utilize the space more efficiently if necessary.
Recently restumped to form a solid base, this property provides a combination of peacefulness, the beauty of the distant views and the opportunity to make this home yours forever. Call our agent for further details.
Insights: 45 other 3 bedroom house in Creswick have recently been sold.

Description:
Large Family Home on Secluded Private 9 Acres
This large brick family home, is located just 10 minutes to Daylesford and 30 minutes to Ballarat. Set on a secluded 9 Acres of natural bush it boasts dual access from Bradshaw Court and Midland Highway. Offering three bedrooms + a fourth bedroom or study, all with BIR. Master bedroom has ensuite, WIR and sliding door access outside onto the wrap around bull nose veranda.
At the centre of the home is a large open-plan kitchen with electric cooking & WIP. Other features include: Two living and dining areas, a cosy snug with a bottled gas log fire, outdoor courtyard entertaining, double lock up garage, full laundry/mud room, main bathroom with double vanity, bath, shower and separate toilet, LED lighting and 9ft ceiling throughout.
- 9 Acres of secluded bush
- Established garden and paved courtyard
- Double LU garage plus 6m x 6m workshop with power connected
- Bottled Gas/ Mains Power / Septic System
- 2 x 22,700 ltr Tanks plus on site bore
Inspections are being offered by private appointment and are recommended.

Description:
Ideal 58 acres on edge of Creswick
Offers around $230,000
Situated on the edge of the thriving township of Creswick and just 20 minutes to central Ballarat, this block offers potential to live the rural lifestyle you have dreamed of, just minutes into town.
Perfectly positioned to build your ideal home (STCA) or alternatively presents a rarely seen opportunity for horse enthusiasts or other rural pursuits. In the Farming Zone this property has several potential home sites with spectacular panoramic views to the district's volcanic hills.
Mainly flat and arable land, 3 main paddocks and 2 catchment dams.
The property has sealed road frontage to Creswick-Lawrence Road and power nearby.
10% Deposit
Settlement: 60/90 days

Description:
From Garage to Golf Course
Designed by Dimension Homes and just 4 years old, this tastefully decorated brick veneer home overlooks the 12th hole, perfect for the golfing enthusiast. Drive the golf buggy directly out of the garage and onto the golf course. Take full advantage of the fantastic views from the huge family/living and well appointed decking. Includes ducted central heating, 4x built-in robes to all bedrooms with walk-in robe to master with en-suite, electric oven, gas cook top & dishwasher. Externally, easy care established gardens, double garage with direct rear access to golf course. A must to inspect for serious buyers.

Description:
Approx. 6.8 acres ideal for weekend camping
Set in a lovely location with views to Mt Grenoch, this 6.8 acre block features cleared & treed areas full of Australian wildlife with option to purchase two containers. Vendor has made a start at lining one of the containers with potential for a more comfortable camping experience. Ideal for trail bike riding with the undulating landscape. Zoned farming. Less than 10 mins to Clunes, 15 minutes to Maryborough and 40 minutes to Ballarat.

Description:
Lifestyle Getaway On 74 Acres Off The Grid
A unique property offering a great lifestyle getaway package for those seeking solitude is this superb property situated at Evansford located within the Pyrenees Shire on this gorgeous 74 acre property which will certainly provide a lifestyle filled with serenity, views and the ability to operate or manage varying rural pursuits.
Situated away from main roads yet accessible via the Waubra-Talbot Road (access via 1502 Waubra-Talbot Road) this property offers a substantial dam plus another main one, scattered trees, cleared acres and rolling views (not to mention plenty of passing native life).
Taking advantage of the views is the gorgeous three bedroom brick veneer home, which offers a full width bull nose veranda, ample outdoor shedding and is off the grid with solar panels and wind turbine reimbursement to battery bank.
Internally the home offers a contemporary fittings and fixtures with a comfortable rural edge with slate floors, brick feature walls, a freestanding combustion heater and timber cathedral ceilings. The kitchen is an open design to meld perfectly with the dining zone, while the lounge is further warmed and designed around the central open fire place. The home has 3 bedrooms with the functionality of the family bathroom, separate toilet and laundry at their fingertips. This simple design would work beautifully for young families or even better for those larger farmers wishing to downscale their operation.
With 74 acres of an assortment of bush and some cleared, this property provides an ultimate getaway weekender or with hobby farms becoming a fashionable trend for baby boomers, this property provides the diversification along with a very reasonable price tag, considering you gain a family home in the package.
For further information, please talk to our agent today

Description:
“DUNERA” 10 ACRES (APPROX.) WITH MAGICAL VIEWS
Set on 10 undulating acres (approx.) with stunning views of the surrounding mountains this property would make the perfect country escape or home site (STCA.) The property includes a two bay barn style shed which has been converted inside into living spaces with a large lounge including wood heater, two bedrooms and a loft. There is a solar power set up with 7 panels and several water tanks. Magnificent views from every direction to enjoy and two large dams. The property is partly treed with some cleared land for animals and is fully fenced.
OPEN FOR INSPECTION SUNDAY 12TH FEB 2.30PM TO 3PM
Alisa Johnson : 0409 935 766

Description:
Beautifully presented Family Entertainer on approx. 1.5 acres
Just minutes from Creswick you will find this beautiful home in a lovely setting with plenty of room to gather family & friends in complete comfort. The huge entertaining area on the east end a bonus to the front and rear veranda. Includes 3 Bedrooms plus study, en-suite & walk-in robe to master, 2 Living areas and masses of storage. North facing bay windows to formal lounge takes full advantage of the winter sun. Keep cosy with wood heating or split system. Easy care landscaped garden with vegie garden, chook shed and dam with jetty. Great shedding plus 4 bay carport. With fantastic views of Springmount, this family home has it all.
